website_summaries.verdict: Simple microwave kiln that's budget friendly and gets the job done.
pros: Compact and fits easy in most standard microwave
Makes glass fusing simple, safe, and economical
cons: Some users discover they can get more out of a larger-sized kiln

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but base broke off.
customer_reviews.text: I love this kiln and have used it many times in the last month. Although I received it for Christmas, it took me almost two months to get over my fear of using it. Then it worked great, just as expected. Until today. I went to remove the lid, and the base detached inside the lid. Now I need to figure out how to repair it or buy a new base. I just ordered the larger one and hope this doesn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Sooz

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten a good one
customer_reviews.text: I had a Fuseworks brand microkiln first and wanted to buy another to use while the Fuseworks one cooled. I've been using them both "to death" and I'm pretty happy, to be honest. This one is the same size as my "original" one and works ALMOST as well. I think pieces take just slightly longer in here but it's not bad. And it's much less expensive than a full-priced Fuseworks. I've even been able to cinter a small silver Art Clay piece in it!!
customer_reviews.author: Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read online that a microwave kiln can be used with precious metal clay. This came with no instructions. Not one piece of paper saying how to use it based on wattage of microwave or that you might need kiln cleaner, kiln shelf liners, or heat proof gloves, or that you might need to remove it immediately from the microwave once the microwave stops or where you might find instructions. So this could be a waste of your money
customer_reviews.author: L. T. Benefield

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: This is not indestructible, but works pretty well. It takes some seasoning to reach temperatures reliably. Mine developed cracks in the metallic lining and one spot where the lining has curled up a bit - maybe from reaching a higher temp than it was designed for. It now gets incandescent after about two minutes in microwave although I generally zap it for about 4 minutes to get sufficient glass melting. The cracks don't seem to affect its heating properties.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Tire Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Works, but heats unevenly
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fuseworks brand microwave kiln that works great! I bought this one for much less than what a Fuseworks brand one costs and find it works ok...quality control not great...it heats unevenly so I need to turn the lid about halfway through...but it does melt the glass. As long as I’m not doing anything too intricate it is okay.
customer_reviews.author: mommy of one

customer_reviews.title: Received with damaged base
customer_reviews.text: Here is my question: I received this with the base damaged in a way that will show up on my finished piece. I could try to fill it with bead release, then top with kiln paper, but if that does not work, may I still return? Please let me know. I will gladly change my review depending on the results. Thank you, Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Had a few casualties but all due, so far, to user trial & error. Found it best to allow the kiln itself to cool for several hours between firings to prevent glass shatter so I will be ordering a second (possibly third) unit to keep me going. Very pleased!

product_meta.title: Love Charm Glass Jewelry Tools Professional Microwave Kiln
product_meta.description:
What is the kiln

Microwave kiln is a new type of high temperature oven for glass melting or softening and it is popular in Europe and the United States areas.It can reach to 900°C (1650 °F) when operating.For heating about 5 minutes,small pieces of glass will be heated to soften shape and glass reprocessing completes.It is compact,safe,convenient,energy saving,environmental proctection and high efficiency.It is a good tools for lampwork glass art processin

Precautions

1. Use of microwave kiln must be padded kiln paper, otherwise the glass will stick on the kiln tray. Replace each time using new kiln paper.

2. If the microwave kiln is wet, the kiln paper is black and yellow instead of white. So the microwave kiln storage to be moisture-proof treatment.

3. Do not put the hot microwave kiln on the microwave oven, wood products, plastic cooling.

4. Do not open the microwave kiln when cooling, cold air instantly into the microwave kiln high heat environment, will cause damage to the microwave kiln.

Microwave kiln of Characteristics

Safety: microwave kiln material for high temperature heat-resistant fiber, although the maximum temperature inside the kiln up to 900°C, but the surface temperature is only about 70°C, as long as the operation properly there will be no danger

Convenience: As long as a set of microwave kiln sets and a home microwave oven, you can become jewelry designer. Simple operation, just 6 minutes to complete a work of art.

Creative: it is popular in Europe and the United States, Japan and South Korea and other regions, so fashionable and elegant art, how can you miss. To achieve childhood whimsy,DIY kiln let you experience the creative fun.

DIY benefits: ease the pressure, cultivate sentiment, self-cultivation and physical experience

DIY kiln advantages: small, safe, environmentally friendly, energy saving and convenient
